DataElement.preferredDefinition: an indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable related to signs and symptoms of blockage of passageway of the stomach and intestines.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to signs and symptoms of blockage of passageway of the stomach and intestines.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (GAS-tro-in-TES-tih-nul) GI.  Refers to the stomach and intestines.:Blockage of a passageway.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to the stomach and intestines.
Blockage of the normal flow of the contents of an anatomical passageway.

Property.preferredDefinition: An indication that a person has a condition or disease.  Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain.

Concepts.definition: Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: signs that a person has a condition or disease. Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain(NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: GOG CRF:Gynecologic Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/not applicable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

Concepts.longName: Yes, No, or Not Applicable Response
Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 04-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 8/3/2015 Corrections made to VD in order to restore to original format: removed C49486 as rep term and replaced with C49797; restored long name and definition per Dianne Reeves/tt.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have clinica
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have clinical symptoms or signs of gastrointestinal obstruction and require parenteral hydration or nutrition?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have evidence of active or acute diverticulitis, intra-abdominal abscess, abdominal/pelvic fistula, gastrointestinal perforation, GI obstruction and/or who require parenteral hydration and/or nutrition?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had any of the following within 6 months of registration: intra-abdominal abscess, gastrointestinal obstruction requiring parenteral hydration and/or nutrition or gastrointestinal perforation?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient require drainage gastronomy tube

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a drainage gastronomy tube?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have current evidence of intra-abdominal abscess, abdominal/pelvic fistula (not diverted), gastrointestinal perforation, GI obstruction, and/or need for drainage nasogastric or gastrostomy tube?

DataElement.origin: GOG CRF:Gynecologic Oncology Group Case Report Form
DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Assessments Ind-3b 2958018v1 with VD ID#3506036 - Yes No Not Applicable Indicator - dbw
